title: ECCV_2016_212_abs

sentences.text: Person re-identification is challenging due to the large variations of pose , illumination , occlusion and camera view .

Owing to these variations , the pedestrian data is distributed as highly-curved manifolds in the feature space , despite the current convolutional neural networks -LRB- CNN -RRB- 's capability of feature extraction .
However , the distribution is unknown , so it is difficult to use the geodesic distance when comparing two samples .
In practice , the current deep embedding methods use the Euclidean distance for the training and test .

On the other hand , the manifold learning methods suggest to use the Euclidean distance in the local range , combining with the graphical relationship between samples , for approximating the geodesic distance .

From this point of view , selecting suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples within a local range is critical for training the CNN embedding , especially when the data has large intra-class variations .
In this paper , we propose a novel moderate positive sample mining method to train robust CNN for person re-identification , dealing with the problem of large variation .
In addition , we improve the learning by a metric weight constraint , so that the learned metric has a better generalization ability .

Experiments show that these two strategies are effective in learning robust deep metrics for person re-identification , and accordingly our deep model significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on several benchmarks of person re-identification .
Therefore , the study presented in this paper may be useful in inspiring new designs of deep models for person re-identification .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
aliases: the study presented in this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel method for moderate positive sample mining aimed at training robust convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for person re-identification, addressing challenges posed by large variations in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view.

mentions.local_name: the study presented in this paper

Entity-moderate_positive_sample_mining_m.label: moderate positive sample mining method
aliases: novel moderate positive sample mining method
Entity-moderate_positive_sample_mining_m.description: The moderate positive sample mining method is a novel approach proposed to enhance the training of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for person re-identification by effectively selecting suitable intra-class training samples within a local range, addressing the challenges posed by large variations in pedestrian data.

mentions.local_name: novel moderate positive sample mining method

Entity-learning_robust_deep_metric.label: learning robust deep metrics
Entity-learning_robust_deep_metric.description: Learning robust deep metrics refers to the process of developing deep learning models that effectively capture and generalize the relationships between data samples, particularly in the context of person re-identification, by utilizing strategies such as moderate positive sample mining and metric weight constraints to enhance performance against variations in pose, illumination, and occlusion.

Entity-deep_embedding_method.label: deep embedding methods
Entity-deep_embedding_method.description: Deep embedding methods refer to machine learning techniques that utilize deep neural networks to learn representations of data in a high-dimensional space, often employing Euclidean distance for training and testing, particularly in the context of person re-identification.

Entity-robust_cnn.label: robust CNN
Entity-robust_cnn.description: Robust CNN refers to a convolutional neural network model specifically designed to enhance person re-identification by effectively handling large variations in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view through novel training methods and improved metric learning.

Entity-strategy.label: strategies
Entity-strategy.description: The term 'strategies' refers to two specific methods proposed in the paper for improving the training of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) in person re-identification, which include a novel moderate positive sample mining method and a metric weight constraint to enhance the generalization ability of the learned metrics.

Entity-study.label: study
Entity-study.description: The study refers to the research presented in the paper that proposes a novel method for moderate positive sample mining to enhance the training of convolutional neural networks for person re-identification.

Entity-the_training_and_test.label: the training and test
Entity-the_training_and_test.description: The training and test refer to the processes of training and evaluating deep embedding methods using Euclidean distance in the context of person re-identification.

Entity-suitable_positive_-lrb-_i.e_._int.label: suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples
aliases: suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples
Entity-suitable_positive_-lrb-_i.e_._int.description: Suitable positive (intra-class) training samples refer to specific examples from the same class that are selected within a local range to effectively train convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for tasks like person re-identification, particularly in scenarios with significant variations among samples.

mentions.local_name: suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples

Entity-test.label: test
Entity-test.description: In the context of deep learning for person re-identification, 'test' refers to the phase where the model evaluates its performance on unseen data using the Euclidean distance metric.

Entity-the_learned_metric.label: the learned metric
Entity-the_learned_metric.description: The learned metric refers to a distance measure that is optimized during the training of a convolutional neural network (CNN) for person re-identification, incorporating a metric weight constraint to enhance its generalization ability across varying intra-class variations.

Entity-our_deep_model.label: our deep model
Entity-our_deep_model.description: Our deep model refers to a novel convolutional neural network designed for person re-identification that incorporates a moderate positive sample mining method and a metric weight constraint to enhance robustness and generalization, outperforming existing state-of-the-art methods.

Entity-these_two_strategy.label: these two strategies
Entity-these_two_strategy.description: These two strategies refer to a novel moderate positive sample mining method and a metric weight constraint that together enhance the learning of robust deep metrics for person re-identification.

Entity-metric_weight_constraint.label: metric weight constraint
Entity-metric_weight_constraint.description: The metric weight constraint refers to a learning constraint applied in the context of deep learning for person re-identification, aimed at enhancing the generalization ability of the learned metric by adjusting the weights associated with different features during training.

Entity-deep_metric.label: deep metrics
Entity-deep_metric.description: Deep metrics refer to advanced evaluation metrics specifically designed for enhancing the performance of deep learning models, particularly in the context of person re-identification, by effectively measuring the similarity between samples in a high-dimensional feature space.

Entity-local_range.label: local range
Entity-local_range.description: The term 'local range' refers to a spatial concept in the context of manifold learning methods, indicating a limited area within which the Euclidean distance is used to approximate the geodesic distance between samples, particularly for selecting suitable positive training samples in person re-identification tasks.

Entity-data.label: data
Entity-data.description: The term 'data' refers to the pedestrian data used in person re-identification, which is characterized by large intra-class variations and is distributed as highly-curved manifolds in the feature space.

Entity-sample.label: samples
Entity-sample.description: In the context of person re-identification, 'samples' refers to the data points or instances used for training and testing deep learning models, specifically focusing on positive intra-class training samples that are critical for effective metric learning.

Entity-person_re-identification.label: person re-identification
Entity-person_re-identification.description: Person re-identification is a computer vision task that involves recognizing and matching individuals across different images or video frames, despite variations in appearance, pose, and lighting conditions.

Entity-learning.label: learning
Entity-learning.description: In this context, 'learning' refers to the process of enhancing the performance of a convolutional neural network (CNN) through the application of a metric weight constraint, aimed at improving the generalization ability of the learned metrics for person re-identification.

Entity-cnn_embedding.label: CNN embedding
Entity-cnn_embedding.description: CNN embedding refers to a feature representation generated by a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) that captures the essential characteristics of input data for tasks such as classification or recognition.

Entity-manifold_learning_method.label: manifold learning methods
Entity-manifold_learning_method.description: Manifold learning methods are a class of machine learning techniques that focus on understanding and modeling the underlying structure of high-dimensional data by representing it in a lower-dimensional space while preserving its geometric properties.

Entity-new_design_of_deep_model.label: new designs of deep models
Entity-new_design_of_deep_model.description: The term 'new designs of deep models' refers to innovative architectures and methodologies for deep learning models specifically tailored to improve person re-identification tasks, addressing challenges such as variations in pose, illumination, and occlusion.

Entity-large_intra-class_variation.label: large intra-class variations
Entity-large_intra-class_variation.description: Large intra-class variations refer to the significant differences in appearance among samples belonging to the same class, which complicate the training of convolutional neural networks for tasks such as person re-identification.

Entity-the_learning.label: the learning
Entity-the_learning.description: The learning refers to the process of enhancing the performance of a deep learning model by applying a metric weight constraint to improve its generalization ability in the context of person re-identification.

Entity-highly-curved_manifold.label: highly-curved manifolds
Entity-highly-curved_manifold.description: Highly-curved manifolds refer to complex geometric structures in the feature space where data points, such as pedestrian representations, are distributed in a non-linear manner due to variations in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view, making it challenging to apply traditional distance metrics like the geodesic distance.

Entity-two_sample.label: two samples
Entity-two_sample.description: In the context of person re-identification, 'two samples' refers to pairs of data points representing individuals, which are compared to assess their similarity or difference in a feature space, particularly when evaluating the effectiveness of distance metrics like geodesic distance.

Entity-the_distribution.label: the distribution
Entity-the_distribution.description: The distribution refers to the unknown statistical distribution of pedestrian data in the feature space, which is characterized by highly-curved manifolds due to variations in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view, complicating the use of geodesic distance for sample comparison.

Entity-benchmark_of_person_re-identifica.label: benchmarks of person re-identification
Entity-benchmark_of_person_re-identifica.description: Benchmarks of person re-identification refer to standardized datasets and evaluation protocols used to assess the performance of algorithms and models in the task of recognizing and matching individuals across different camera views.

Entity-cnn.label: CNN
Entity-cnn.description: CNN refers to Convolutional Neural Networks, which are a class of deep learning algorithms primarily used for processing structured grid data such as images.

Entity-graphical_relationship.label: graphical relationship
Entity-graphical_relationship.description: The term 'graphical relationship' refers to the connections or associations between data samples in a feature space, which are utilized in manifold learning methods to approximate geodesic distances by combining local Euclidean distances.

Entity-better_generalization_ability.label: better generalization ability
Entity-better_generalization_ability.description: Better generalization ability refers to the enhanced capacity of a learned metric in a convolutional neural network to perform effectively on unseen data, particularly in the context of person re-identification, by utilizing a metric weight constraint during training.

Entity-convolutional_neural_network.label: convolutional neural networks
Entity-convolutional_neural_network.description: Convolutional neural networks are a class of deep learning algorithms designed to process and analyze visual data by mimicking the way the human brain perceives images, utilizing layers of convolutional filters to extract features from input data.

Entity-pedestrian_data.label: pedestrian data
Entity-pedestrian_data.description: Pedestrian data refers to the collection of information related to individuals walking in various conditions, which is characterized by complex distributions in feature space due to variations in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view, impacting the effectiveness of feature extraction methods like convolutional neural networks.

Entity-large_variation.label: large variation
Entity-large_variation.description: The term 'large variation' refers to the significant differences in pose, illumination, occlusion, and camera view that complicate the task of person re-identification in computer vision.

Entity-graphical_relationship_between_sa.label: graphical relationship between samples
Entity-graphical_relationship_between_sa.description: The term 'graphical relationship between samples' refers to the connections and interactions among data points in a feature space, which are utilized in manifold learning methods to approximate geodesic distances by considering local structures in the data distribution.

Entity-deep_model.label: deep models
Entity-deep_model.description: Deep models are a class of machine learning models that utilize multiple layers of processing to learn representations of data, often associated with deep learning techniques.

Entity-pose.label: pose
Entity-pose.description: In the context of person re-identification, 'pose' refers to the various physical orientations and positions of a person that can significantly affect the recognition process due to their variability.

Entity-the_feature_space.label: the feature space
Entity-the_feature_space.description: The feature space refers to the multidimensional space in which the characteristics or features of data points, such as pedestrian images in person re-identification, are represented, allowing for the analysis of their distribution and relationships, particularly in the context of variations in pose, illumination, and occlusion.

Entity-training_sample.label: training samples
Entity-training_sample.description: Training samples are specific instances of data used to train machine learning models, particularly to help the model learn patterns and make predictions.

Entity-occlusion.label: occlusion
Entity-occlusion.description: In the context of person re-identification, 'occlusion' refers to the visual obstruction of a person's appearance caused by other objects or individuals, which complicates the task of accurately identifying and matching individuals across different camera views.

Entity-feature_extraction.label: feature extraction
Entity-feature_extraction.description: Feature extraction is a data processing technique used in machine learning to transform raw data into a set of relevant features that can be used for analysis or model training.

Entity-several_benchmark.label: several benchmarks
Entity-several_benchmark.description: Several benchmarks refer to standardized datasets and evaluation metrics used to assess the performance of person re-identification methods in the context of this research.

Entity-illumination.label: illumination
Entity-illumination.description: In the context of person re-identification, 'illumination' refers to the variations in lighting conditions that affect the appearance of individuals in images, posing challenges for accurate recognition and comparison.

Entity-euclidean_distance.label: Euclidean distance
Entity-euclidean_distance.description: Euclidean distance is a distance metric that measures the straight-line distance between two points in Euclidean space, calculated as the square root of the sum of the squared differences of their coordinates.

Entity-camera_view.label: camera view
Entity-camera_view.description: The term 'camera view' refers to the specific visual perspective or angle from which a scene is captured, which can significantly affect the challenges in person re-identification due to variations in pose, illumination, and occlusion.

Entity-geodesic_distance.label: geodesic distance
Entity-geodesic_distance.description: Geodesic distance is a measure of the shortest path between two points on a curved surface or in a curved space, often used in the context of differential geometry and manifold theory.

Entity-training.label: training
Entity-training.description: Training is a process in which a model learns from data to improve its performance on a specific task.

Entity-intra-class_variation.label: intra-class variations
Entity-intra-class_variation.description: Intra-class variations refer to the differences or diversity observed among samples that belong to the same class or category, often affecting the performance of classification models.

Entity-manifold.label: manifolds
Entity-manifold.description: Manifolds are mathematical structures that generalize the concept of curves and surfaces to higher dimensions, allowing for the study of geometric properties and spatial relationships in a flexible and abstract way.

Entity-feature_space.label: feature space
Entity-feature_space.description: A feature space is a mathematical representation of data points in a multi-dimensional space where each dimension corresponds to a specific feature or attribute of the data.

Entity-generalization_ability.label: generalization ability
Entity-generalization_ability.description: generalization ability refers to the capability of a model or system to perform well on unseen data or tasks that were not part of its training set.

Entity-state-of-the-art_method.label: state-of-the-art methods
Entity-state-of-the-art_method.description: state-of-the-art methods refer to the most advanced and effective techniques or approaches currently available in a particular field, often used as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of new methods.

Entity-benchmark.label: benchmarks
Entity-benchmark.description: Benchmarks are standardized tests or criteria used to evaluate the performance or effectiveness of various methods, models, or systems in a specific domain.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written academic document that presents research findings, methodologies, or theoretical discussions, typically published in a journal or conference proceedings.

summary: Person re-identification is challenging due to the large variations of pose , illumination , occlusion and camera view . Owing to these variations , the pedestrian data is distributed as highly-curved manifolds in the feature space , despite the current convolutional neural networks -LRB- CNN -RRB- 's capability of feature extraction . However , the distribution is unknown , so it is difficult to use the geodesic distance when comparing two samples . In practice , the current deep embedding methods use the Euclidean distance for the training and test . On the other hand , the manifold learning methods suggest to use the Euclidean distance in the local range , combining with the graphical relationship between samples , for approximating the geodesic distance . From this point of view , selecting suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples within a local range is critical for training the CNN embedding , especially when the data has large intra-class variations . In this paper , we propose a novel moderate positive sample mining method to train robust CNN for person re-identification , dealing with the problem of large variation . In addition , we improve the learning by a metric weight constraint , so that the learned metric has a better generalization ability . Experiments show that these two strategies are effective in learning robust deep metrics for person re-identification , and accordingly our deep model significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on several benchmarks of person re-identification . Therefore , the study presented in this paper may be useful in inspiring new designs of deep models for person re-identification .

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object.
